title: Senior Google Ads (PPC) Account Manager
company_info: We are a digital marketing agency built by locals, for the locals. Since 2012, we’ve helped more than 1000 brands in the region, big and small, grow their online presence. With accreditations from Google, Yahoo, Bing, and Facebook, we know just all the right tips and tricks to get your brand found online. Looking for a way to show up to people online, quickly, effectively, and conveniently? If you want to get heard online, we can help.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a Senior Google Ads (PPC) Account Manager who will take personal responsibility for the success of new and existing clients’ PPC campaigns and make them his or her own. In this position, the PPC Account Manager will be responsible for all tasks related to client’s PPC campaigns including keyword research, conversions rates, bidding strategy, landing page optimization, call to action, ad copy and campaign management.

The Account manager is required to participate in all aspects of the client’s paid search campaigns, including initial planning, implementation, monitoring, optimization, analysis and reporting. The Account manager is also responsible for day to day progress of clients’ PPC campaigns and ensuring timely completion and success of related tasks.

Rewards:
High basic salary
Medical and insurance coverage
Yearly pay increment
Additional 2 days of annual leave every year
Able to attend internal and external courses
Manage some of Singapore’s biggest brand campaigns
Work alongside with an award winning team (Winner of Search Marketing Agency Of The Year 2022 & Lead Generation Agency Of The Year 2022)
A super fun and dynamic company culture
Work from home / Report to office 2 days per week
Responsibilities:
Keyword research, creating of ad copy, conversions rates, bidding, call to action and campaign management
Assist with timely planning and execution of PPC campaign
Analyze keyword costs, split testing, landing pages, cost per conversion and inform management of client opportunities, potential risks, and other key issues
Data analysis and tracking via Google Tag Manager and Analytics
Generate monthly reports with data-driven recommendations
Properly link Ads with Webmaster Tools and Google Analytics
Clear communication on PPC best practices to team members and guide them on how to apply to our client campaigns
Proactively contribute to account strategy and provide recommendations to meet clients’ goals
Responding to clients’ emails and call
Maintain knowledge of industry news including best practices
Requirements:
STRICTLY Singaporean or PR holder only
Minimum 2-year Google Ads experience OR 1-year experience in a digital marketing agency environment
Must hold the relevant Google Ads certifications
Fluent in written and spoken English
Great with client management
Possesses self-initiative, hardworking and responsible
Resourceful, cheerful disposition with a positive working attitude
Why Us:
Voted by Adidas, CapitaLand, Grab, Lazada, Alibaba, L’Oréal, Hilton, Zalora and UOB, we are the winner of Search Marketing Agency of the year 2022. We are also the winner of Lead Generation Agency of the year 2022.

With an ongoing expansion plan, we want to gather the best talents in Singapore and bring Impossible Marketing globally. This means that you get to manage some of the biggest brand campaigns in Singapore and Asia.

In addition, we are probably the only Digital Marketing Agency in Singapore who takes CSR seriously. We launched “Project KATE” back in 2015 and have since supported multiple charity organisations and the less fortunate for free.

More info: https://www.impossible.sg/

title: New Markets Account Executive, Mid Market, Vietnam
company_info: Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” six years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” nine years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
New Markets Account Executive, Mid Market, Vietnam
About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good– you’ve come to the right place.

Overview of the Role:

Salesforce is looking for a curious and energetic Mid Market Account Executive with knowledge of technology and value-based solution selling. This Business Unit sells the entire Salesforce platform into a small set of named accounts. Think of yourself as the "General Manager" in this role - mapping account strategies, aligning resources and acting as the extension of your customer. You will work closely with other product specialists known as co-primes to help map out the best strategy for your customer. You will have technical support from solutions architects and sales engineers.

This role will be responsible for the Vietnam territory.

Responsibilities:
In this role, you will work closely with current and prospective customers as a trusted digital advisor to deeply understand their outstanding company challenges and goals.

You will collaborate with customers on the Salesforce Platform to evangelize solutions that will help them reach their business goals and blaze new trails within their organisations. You will contribute to our business, as a valued member of our Ohana.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Demonstrated success of quota carrying, technology solution-based direct sales experience
Account Planning and Strategies: Establishes plans to achieve sales objectives by effectively identifying and qualifying opportunities for the Vietnam market
Research and Discovery: Uncovers a prospect’s current processes, business challenges, and strategic goals based on customer use cases and value hypotheses.
Solutioning: Identifies compelling value propositions that address customer needs by demonstrating an understanding of technology solutions.
Customer Communication: Interacting with customers in a clear, concise, and timely manner using a variety of communication methods (writing, speech, presentation) and tools (whiteboarding, Google Slides, Zoom).
Resource Application: Continuously runs toward results using the full capabilities of available resources and tools.
Team Selling: Aligns with the full capacities of the account team and partners to support the deal and customer success.
Language: Fluent in written and spoken Vietnamese.
Preferred Skills and Qualifications:
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills.
Sales Methodology education.
Ability to develop cases and service requirements, while crafting and leading strategic alliances.
Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment.
Track record of consistently achieving or surpassing quota,
Benefits & Perks
Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including well-being reimbursement, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more.

Note: By applying to the Mid Market Account Executive posting, recruiters and hiring managers who support multiple cloud offerings and verticals across the organization hiring General Commercial Account Executives will review your resume. Our goal is for you to apply once and have your resume reviewed by multiple hiring teams.

Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.

Salesforce welcomes all.

Roles & Responsibilities
Project Performance Specialist (Project Controller/ FP&A/ Accounts)

12-Month Contract
Industry : Pharmaceutical
Location: Gul Cirlce
Salary up to $6000 depending on experience

Job Summary:
Responsible for the delivery of Operational and Financial sustainable results across the Scientific Affairs organization.
Ensure that all project expenses are properly accounted for, that all purchase orders align with project budgets and timelines, and that all necessary steps are taken to manage projects effectively.

Responsibilities
Key Results:
Accurate tracking and reporting of project budgets, including regular updates on budget vs. actual spend
Timely and efficient processing of purchase orders, ensuring that all necessary approvals are obtained and that all purchases are made in accordance with project budgets and timelines
Effective communication of purchase order information to project stakeholders, including regular updates on the status of purchase orders and any relevant budget or timeline changes
Effective project management, including delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to the desired quality standards

Accountabilities:
Monitor project budgets and provide regular updates to project managers and stakeholders
Manage the purchase order process, including creating and submitting purchase orders for approval, tracking the status of orders, and ensuring timely receipt of goods and services
Communicate basic purchase order information to project stakeholders, including order status, delivery dates, and any relevant budget or timeline changes
Provide project management oversight, including ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the desired quality standards
Ensure that all purchase orders are in compliance with project budgets and timelines
Collaborate with project managers and stakeholders to resolve any budget, purchase order, or project management issues that arise
Maintain accurate records of all purchase orders, project budget information, and project management information.

Requirements:
Extensive technical knowledge of MS tools, especially Excel and Power-point. Knowledge of Power BI and share-point are ideal
Demonstrated good project coordination and data analysis skills based on information reported from a broad variety of sources
Excellent influencing, negotiation skill to build consensus and drive resolution of issues while maintaining positive working relationships across functions


If you possess above relevant skillsets, please send in your updated CV in word format to Apple.lim@manpower.com.sg

company_info: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's capital position, as well as "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings, is among the highest in Asia-Pacific. DBS has been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by The Banker, a member of the Financial Times group, and “Best Bank in Asia-Pacific” by Global Finance. The bank has also been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for seven consecutive years from 2009 to 2015.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
As an Operations Department, we embrace and reinforce the strong PRIDE! culture that is built up in DBS. This is done through strategic focus on training and improving staff capability, empowerment, productivity, teamwork, innovation & technology, managing operational risks & strongly collaborating with our business partners in delivering excellent RED service to our customers.
The role of R&M Officer (Processing) is to perform and ensure timely and accurate set-up/maintenance of customers' profiles in e-banking platforms.
Key Accountabilities
To ensure that cut off times and SLAs of various products are met.
To ensure 100% accuracy and quality in tasks performed.
Ensure handling of enquiries and updating of statuses of cases are timely and accurate.
Responsibilities
Set up and maintain profiles of customers in various ebanking systems in accordance to forms submitted.
Perform tagging of users as authorisers/administrators in system when required.
Handle enquiries & follow up.
Update tracking spreadsheets.
Perform Live verification of systems.
Any other duties assigned in the course of work or rotation of duties.
Requirements
University graduate with relevant banking operations experience preferred.
A collaborative team player with good communications skills.
Able to work independently with accuracy in a fast pace environment.
Basic knowledge and skills of Microsoft Word, Access & Excel.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Specifications:
Manage and maintain the full set of accounts for CKH Food Trading.
Prepare monthly management reports to Parent (PSC Corporation) company.
Ensure compliance to parent company’s requirements.
This position reports to the Financial Controller / CFO.
Core Responsibilities:

Manage and maintain full spectrum of accounts and reporting function including the following:
· Provide reliable, accurate and timely financial information to the Management and parent company.
· Preparing, analyzing and interpreting financial and management reports.
· Ensures full compliance with accepted accounting principles, accounting policies and procedures, balance sheet reviews and internal controls processes.
· Assist in formulating accounting policies and strategies, financial and management accounting, costing, taxation and all finance-related matters
· Reconcile intercompany accounts balances with related companies and parent company.
· Responsible for monthly account reconciliations.
· Maintain the fixed asset sub ledger.
· Statutory reporting - liaise with auditors and tax agents.
· Implement continuous improvement projects to enhance operational efficiency.

Requirements:

· Minimum Degree / ACCA or CPA in Accountancy.
· 4 to 6 years of related experience in trading company environment.
· Able to handle full sets of accounts and prepare management reports to the parent company.
· Works independently.
· Analytical and an eye for details.
· Team player.
· Able to work under tight schedule and pressure.
· Short notice to start work will be an advantage.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Accountant
Supportive Management Team
Based in the East
Salary Circa - $4500 to $5000 per month
The Company
Our client is a services and project company with operations around South East Asia. As part of their expansion plan, they are now looking to recruit and experienced Accountant to be part of their finance team.

The Position
Reporting to the Finance Manager, and managing a team of junior executives, the Accountant will be involved in GL and AP functions whilst assisting in the preparation of management reporting, annual budgets and cash flow projections. The Accountant will be involved in ensuring the timely closing of the accounts, submission of reports, and reviewing work done by junior staff. There will also be a need to be involved in any ad-hoc projects and assignments.

The Person
To succeed in this role, candidates should have at least 5 years of working experience in accounting / finance. Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential as well as a willingness to learn. This is an excellent opportunity to work in a company and with a highly enthusiastic and supportive hiring manager.

title: Accountant
company_info: Based in Singapore, Lumens Group is a family of brands offering an ecosystem of services around cars. Our story began as a private hire car leasing company to address the needs of the new sharing economy led by Uber and Grab. Our core business has been leasing to ride hailing drivers and we grew our car fleet to one of the largest in Singapore in under 8 years. During this time, we have expanded our services to personal & corporate vehicle leasing, vehicle purchasing and financing. Emerging strong from the Covid-19 period, Lumens is building for an exciting new era that brings in a wide range of merchants and individual consumers to our ecosystem. By owning a critical mass of vehicles and driver relationships, we are able to innovate on vehicle setup, driver upskilling & deployment, as well as technology and data capabilities to build mobility platform services that impact our everyday lives.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our Team
Based in Singapore, Lumens Group is a family of brands offering an ecosystem of services around cars. Our story began as a private hire car leasing company to address the needs of the new sharing economy led by Uber and Grab. Our core business has been leasing to ride hailing drivers and we grew our car fleet to one of the largest in Singapore in under 8 years. During this time, we have expanded our services to personal & corporate vehicle leasing, vehicle purchasing and financing.
Emerging strong from the Covid-19 period, Lumens is building for an exciting new era that brings in a wide range of merchants and individual consumers to our ecosystem. By owning a critical mass of vehicles and driver relationships, we are able to innovate on vehicle setup, driver upskilling & deployment, as well as technology and data capabilities to build mobility platform services that impact our everyday lives.

Responsibilities
Support the CFO in accounting monthly closing and reporting activities
Lead and drive the Finance department towards accounting ERP migration & RAP processing
Champion the ERP system, to ensure it is utilized to its full potential, to continually improve processes and efficiency with finance function and wider business
Responsible for full spectrum of finance functions in accordance with statutory requirements, financial accounting regulations, company policies and procedures
Prepare management reports and perform financial analysis
Responsible for financial planning, forecasting, budgeting & analysis of financial accounts
Review group entities accounts
Liaise with Auditors to ensure appropriate documenting and monitoring of internal controls
Preparation and submission of GST filing, government surveys and corporate tax
Manage and review inter-company reconciliation and confirmation
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, Finance, ACCA or its equivalent.
At least 5 years of accounting or relevant working experience.
Proficiency in using Power BI or similar tolls for business analysis will be advantage.
Good knowledge of accounting regulatory compliance.
Meticulous, performance-oriented, self-motivated personality with good interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong advanced Microsoft Excel with analytical skills.
Self-motivated, proactive, independent, take responsibility and ownership of task assigned and see tasks to completion.
Good communication , coordination and presentation skills.

Medical and dental coverage
Reputably branded staff cafe
In house gym and fitness corner
Recreational activities
Exclusive staff petrol discount

title: Accountant
company_info: RecruiterPal is a cloud-based recruitment platform that helps you to recruit staff faster and easier, giving you full control and overview of your entire recruitment process.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
About BW Group 
BW Group is a leading global maritime company involved in shipping, maritime infrastructure, and new sustainable technologies. Founded in 1955, BW controls a fleet of over 450 vessels and other floating assets, including oil production, gas import terminals, and wind-farm installation. The Group’s fleet of over 200 LNG and LPG ships constitutes the largest gas fleet in the world. In the renewables space, the Group has investments in solar, wind, batteries, biofuels and water treatment. BW has nine publicly listed affiliates on the Oslo and New York Stock Exchange. Our main operating centres are in Singapore, Copenhagen, Oslo, Houston, London, Manila, Mumbai and Rio de Janeiro.  
Are you ready to make an impact? 
What drives us is our mission to deliver energy for the world today, and to find solutions for tomorrow. If you want to make lives better around the world by providing access to energy, while working on sustainability and decarbonisation, we’d like to hear from you. Working at BW you will feel the pulse of the world each day. If something happens in the world, we feel it, and you can play your part by anticipating and responding to it. Our high-performing teams are drawn to BW by the global nature of our work and the satisfaction of working with collaborative people who inspire each other to deliver exceptional results. 
RESPONSIBILITIES
Prepare consolidated financial statements and statutory information timely and accurately
Update accounting records in Oracle in a timely and accurate manner for designated companies.
Review accounting entries created in Oracle
Produce monthly, quarterly, yearly and adhoc financial reports timely and accurately
Perform controlling functions in relation to providing accurate financial results and identifying weaknesses in contracts / systems, if any
Assist in the preparation of board and audit committee presentation materials
Be up-to-date on relevant accounting standards, in particular the IFRS; and assist to ensure the group accounts complies with the relevant accounting standards and group accounting policy
Ensure fixed assets and depreciation data are updated in a timely and accurate manner for designated group(s)
Prepare audit schedules and liaise with auditors accordingly
Participate in the new consolidation system migration and testing
Actively participate and engage in the process for the continuous improvement of departmental procedures through QMS
QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Accounting preferred
Minimum 1-2 years of experience in:
Commercial accounting (shipping industry preferred) with involvement in GL reporting or financial reporting
Hands on experience in consolidation, year-end audit process, and preparation of financial statements and reports
Strong computer skills & experience in computerized accounting / ERP systems an advantage
Ability to deliver high quality work under tight deadlines
Committed, responsible, organized, meticulous and good number sense
Team player, with good interpersonal and communication skills
OTHER INFORMATION
At BW, we offer challenging work in an international environment with a team of dedicated and competent colleagues. We recognise that the success of BW rests with each employee’s ability to provide the necessary skills and confidence within the team, and our training is tailored to suit individual needs and career aspirations.
Vision: Best on Water
Mission: We deliver energy for the world today, and find solutions for tomorrow
Values
Collaborative
Ambitious
Reliable
Enduring
If our values resonate with you and you think you can contribute, we would be delighted to hear from you!
Don't meet every single requirement? At BW, we value diversity and the unique experiences that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. We welcome you to apply for the role even if you don't fully meet all the listed requirements, especially if you are passionate about building an inclusive culture where we strive to be our best. You may be just the right candidate!
Information for Recruitment Agencies:
BW endeavours to recruit and fill vacancies directly. However, when we do need to engage with agencies, BW operates a preferred supplier list (PSL) and will not be accepting unsolicited applications from non-PSL agencies for this role.
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - BW Maritime

title: Senior Accounts / Accounts Executive
company_info: Who We Are Established in 1974, C&M is a leading importer and distributor for more than 200 chemicals and chemistry products in Asia-Pacific and also carry a wide range of state-of-art plating and engineering machinery solutions. We also provide customers with critical storage and inventory support from our Warehouse and Technical Service Centre in 4 Tuas South. We are a dynamic and innovative company operating at the intersection of electronics, aviation, and automotive industries. With a decade of hands-on experience, we have carved a niche for ourselves in these fields. In recent years, we have also ventured into new growth opportunities related to food and agriculture. Our desire is to build a team comprising of individuals who are passionate in what they do and have an innate interest to strive for operation efficiencies and business growth. We are headquartered in Singapore with subsidiaries and joint ventures in Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand and Vietnam. What We Value C&M serves customersfrom across different industries with the same quality of personal attention from its management team. We continue to be dedicated to meeting customers’ needs effectively and efficiently whilst proudly surpassingindustry standards with our cutting-edge chemical and machinery solutions. https://www.chemacasia.com/chemicals-machinery-made-of-value
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are a dynamic and innovative company operating at the intersection of electronics, aviation, and automotive industries. With a decade of hands-on experience, we have carved a niche for ourselves in these fields. In recent years, we have also ventured into new growth opportunities related to food and agriculture. We are now seeking for a talent to join us on this exciting journey.

Our team is constantly seizing opportunities for learning and growth. If you possess an innate interest to utilise your competencies and partner our business leaders to achieve operation efficiency, we invite you to be a part of our team to shape our future together.

Talent Profile:
Possess at least 3-5 years of technical skills and experience in the field of finance and accounting
Understand that confidentiality is of utmost importance
Is self-driven, meticulous and a good team player
Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders and external customers
Has a passion for learning, mastering new skills and keeping abreast with new accounting principles or practices
Possess effective problem solving, planning & analytical skills
Is proficient in Microsoft Office and has the relevant experience in handing financial or enterprise-wide systems such as SAP or MS Dynamics 365
Possess a Diploma or a Bachelor Degree in Accounting/Finance/Business Administration or equivalent from recognised institutions

Key Roles & Responsibilities:
Handle full set of accounts
Manage and supervise the daily accounting operations for each business unit and provide coaching/advice to the accounting team as and when needed
Prepare for tax computations and deal with banks and relevant government bodies for tax and/or accounting matters
Support the annual forecast & budgeting exercise and financial audit process
Complete and review the full set of accounts for each business unit, both local and overseas
Monitor and provide timely reporting of the performance of the business unit based on key performance indicators
Prepare consolidated financial statements, business activity reports and forecasts for periodic management reporting
Provide administrative support for the investment portfolios and provide regular reporting to the management
Ensure that additional or ad-hoc tasks and projects assigned are completed on a timely basis
Any other duties and responsibilities may be varied from time to time at the sole discretion of the Company

title: Accounts Executive
company_info: C+H ASSOCIATES PTE. LTD. A member of Taisei Group, Japan C+H Associates Pte Ltd is a company specialises in Facilities Management & Maintenance and SMART FM Solutions & Consultancy. Leveraging on the highly qualified and experienced staff, we are able to offer comprehensive services throughout the entire life cycle of a facility, such as consultancy, minor construction, project management, integrated facilities management; repair and redecorations and upgrading works.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The Accounts Executive provides key support to the finance department. He/She will cover duties such as accounts receivable, accounts payable, tax filing, data entry/compilation, billing, generating of accounting reports or other accounting tasks.

Responsibilities:
Handle day-to-day accounting functions, such as managing all invoices/billings including keying in data into accounting system.
Petty cash compilations, claiming and updating of records accordingly.
Ensure proper filling of accounts documentations and supporting documents.
Accounts payable tasks which involve processing supplier invoices, verifying payment details, and coordinating with vendors for timely payments.
Accounts receivable tasks which include generating customer invoices, tracking payments, and following up on overdue accounts.
Generating of taxation / accounting reports.
Bank reconciliation to ensure accuracy and identify any discrepancies.
Liaising with auditors in their queries during financial year reporting.
Assist in handling incoming calls and visitors.
Other duties such as providing general office admin support such as upkeeping of stationery/pantry supplies and office maintenance.

Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least Higher NITEC certificate in accounting / Diploma in Accounting or equivalent.
At least 2-3 years working experience in related field is preferred.
Proficient in MS Office Outlook, Words, Excel, PowerPoint etc.
Knowledge in Xero accounting software would be an added advantage.
Well organized, meticulous and an eye to detail.
Ability to work independently with minimum supervision and effective at prioritizing and meeting tight deadlines at times.
Preferably to start work immediately or within short notice.

Interested applicants please indicate your availability, expected salary and reason for leaving your previous employments in your resume.

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB PURPOSE: (Role Summary)

The Accounts Executive will be responsible for supporting the Senior Accounts Executive in all aspects of day-to-day accounting functions and operational activities. This position reports to the Senior Accounts Executive and to the Company Accounts and Finance Head.

KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:

The responsibilities shall mainly include:

Accounts
1.Accounts payable review including:
a. Vendor Payments (starting from issue of PO, obtaining approval, vendor bill review, rebilling, payment monitoring, vendor account reconciliation and closure in Accounting system)
b. Expenses review (recording in Accounting systems, verification with policies, documentation and approvals review, etc.).
c. Salary (including yearly bonus) and reimbursement processing, verification and approval from management.

2. Petty Cash management
3. Supporting in closure of pending Sales orders, invoicing, documentation required thereof.
4. Bank statement and bank reconciliation review.
5. Ledger Scrutiny and reconciliation on monthly basis.

Statutory compliances

Annual Compliance management with statutory requirements (including applicable laws, Insurance, safety regulations, requirements of Ministry of Manpower, etc.)
GST compliance:
Supporting in preparation of GST working and submission of quarterly GST return.
Documentation review (e.g. Sign and stamp on delivery notes for zero rated sales)

HR
Documentation review of employees.
Leave and attendance record maintenance.

Administration
Processing of employee Visa application, Ministry of Manpower pass requirements, etc.

Inventory Management
Responsible to manage and review Inventory control in Zoho for receipts, issues, stock balance.
Review and monitoring of consistency between physical stock taking and accounting records.

Miscellaneous
Fixed Asset register including annual physical verification.
Maintenance and preparation of documentation including policies and processes.
MIS reporting as and when needed.

General
Liaising with internal stakeholders and external stakeholders such as Banks, Auditors, Recruitment Agencies, Vendors, etc.

TCS wholly owns Trans-cab Logistics Pte Ltd ("TLC"), a company principally involved in the sale and purchase of diesel and the operation of diesel pump stations. Our Group's core business is the operation of taxis in Singapore where we are the 2nd largest taxi operator. Since our establishment on 28 April 2003, our fleet size has grown rapidly within a short span of about six years from 50 taxis in 2003 to 3,159 taxis as at 31 December 2009, making us the second largest taxi operator in Singapore. Our taxi fleet includes 100 units of Mercedes taxis aimed to cater to the increasing demand for premium taxi services by business executives and tourists. In line with the Singapore Government's initiatives to foster a green environment with less pollution, we recognised that corporate responsibility is integral to creating a meaningful consumer and community connection and to achieving a positive impact on the environment.

company_info: YJP Surveyors Pte Ltd (YJP) is one of Singapore’s leading survey corporations. Established in 1993, YJP employs some fifty survey specialists and have been actively involved in consultation and survey services relating to land, hydrographic and environmental works. We are conveniently based in Singapore to provide land, hydrographic and environmental surveys to the region. Our completed jobs include both national and regional nature. We believe in using the latest technologies and are committed to invest in state of the art equipment and instruments to deliver precision and quality work to our clients. YJP Surveyors is certified in ISO 9001 (Quality Management System) and has EBS-OPITO safety certificates. We specialize in providing accurate and cost competitive services in the field of surveying and environmental measurements. YJP maintains its competitive edge by utilizing a combination of investment in advance technology, external / in-house training and a can-do mindset. Our area of operation extends beyond Singapore shores. Some of the countries we have worked in are Vietnam, Malaysia, Thailand, Cambodia and the Philippines. Whether its for sand searches, ROVs inspection works or accurate positioning for installation of sensitive equipment, we undertake each task diligently and successfully. We pride ourself in acquiring accurate information in challenging situations and delivering the products at a timely manner to our Clients. Our Scope of work is broad and varies from coastal surveys to high precision underwater pipes inspection using multibeam and ROVs.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for passionate team players to join us in managing our portfolio of B2B2C Loyalty and CRM programs. You will be responsible for operating and implementing day to day program activities, reports and deployment of digital innovations with close collaboration with internal and external teams. The role covers understanding, applying and enhancing business processes, marketing operations and digital technology engagements.

Job Description:

The Account Manager grows/retains a portfolio of accounts and is responsible for building client relationships, developing account management strategies, coordinating with internal teams to deliver solutions that meet clients' needs, and identifying opportunities to grow accounts.

Account Manager demonstrates CRM/Loyalty/Marketing expertise. Together with Project Management, strong quantitative and qualitative skills, Account Manager leads internal teams and external clients, representing strong business skills and functional skills.

Key Responsibilities:
Provide leadership and support during strategy, concept, and execution.
Partners with internal teams to drive value and engagement.
Looks for ways to improve account growth by understanding clients’ objectives and goals.
Demonstrates ability to communicate, present and influence effectively at all levels.
An expert at building credibility and trust while influencing buying decisions.
Experience in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs.
Effectively presents insights and recommendations and point-of-view.
Assists and advises account and financial management relating to account profitability.
Fosters a collaborative environment to encourage an exchange of ideas between cross-teams.
Perceives obstacles and objections as an opportunity to engage, consult, and deliver value.

Compliances and controls

Ownership of compliance with the Group’s policies, procedures, and deadlines.
Cash and Taxation
Ownership of proper tax compliances and filing for both direct and indirect taxes in the entities assigned.
Liaise closely with HR/payroll on personal income tax liability and exposures.
Follow up diligently on cash collections via timely information provision and discussions with the local commercial and operations team, highlighting issues and actions promptly.
Other
Support budgeting process
Participation in other group and regional initiatives

company_info: We provide professional services including accounting software (retail, support and training), auditing, accounting, insurance, GST returns, tax returns (corporate and personal), secretarial, Entrepass application, incorporation and closing of companies. Our firm is Approved Training Organisation. According to our accountants’ feedback, they have learned a lot while in our firm as they learned accounting, audit and tax with work life balance and mostly working till 6pm-7pm. Our audit partners and managers and senior accountants conduct regular coaching of our accountants. We have regular outing for team bonding. We have many documented SOPs for newcomers to read first, then clarify with buddies if not sure. Our reviewers have to review all drafts before they are sent to clients, as part of quality check. Our founding audit partner, SB Tan was in Ernst & Young and KPMG for 6 years before she set up our firm in 1998 under S B Tan & Co. Our other audit partner, Seet Lee, was in PwC for several years before joining our firm 10 years ago.

title: Account Executive / Assistant
company: SABANA REAL ESTATE INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT PTE. LTD.
company_info: Listed on Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited since 26 November 2010, Sabana REIT has a diversified property portfolio valued at S$1.0 billion as at 31 December 2017, comprising 19 properties strategically located across Singapore. Sabana REIT has four main industrial property segments: High-tech Industrial, Chemical Warehouse and Logistics, Warehouse and Logistics and General Industrial. As at 31 December 2017, Sabana REIT continued to be one of the largest listed Shari'ah compliant industrial real estate investment trusts ("REIT") in the world in terms of total asset size. The Trust is managed by an external manager, Sabana Real Estate Investment Management Pte. Ltd. (the "Manager"). Sabana Real Estate Investment Management Pte. Ltd. was incorporated in Singapore on 15 March 2010 and is wholly owned by Sabana Investment Partners Pte. Ltd. ("SIP") of which the shareholders are Freight Links Express Holdings Limited (the "Sponsor"), Blackwood Investment Pte. Ltd. and Atrium Asia Capital Partners Pte. Ltd., formerly known as Tarian Capital Partners Pte. Ltd.. Armed with deep knowledge and expertise on the Singapore industrial property market, the Manager sets the strategic direction for Sabana REIT, manages its assets, and makes recommendations to the Trustee on issues related to acquisitions, divestment and asset enhancements. In addition, the Manager adheres to guidelines set out by the Independent Shari'ah Committee to ensure that Sabana REIT has adopted a standard of Shari'ah compliance that is generally accepted in the Gulf Cooperation Council ("GCC") region in all aspects of its operation. Sabana Property Management Pte. Ltd. ("SPM") is the Property Manager of Sabana REIT. The Property Manager has a team of dedicated professionals actively in contact with tenants of Sabana REIT's properties to ensure the smooth operation of all of the buildings. SPM also manages the leasing function of Sabana REIT's portfolio of properties.

title: Account Executive
company_info: AKA Asia started life as a strategically creative PR agency in 2009, challenging convention in Singapore and across Asia Pacific. Over 13 years later, AKA has evolved into a multiple award-winning integrated communications agency, helping brands engage their audiences through compelling content (digital, social and traditional). Boasting an enviable client list of globally recognised brands, AKA has become synonymous with conceptualising and executing fearlessly creative communications campaigns locally, regionally and globally, which help brands unleash the business potential of communications. AKA actively works with likeminded affiliate partners across Asia Pacific, the UK and the US. The agency’s powerful client portfolio includes global MNCs, regional heroes and homegrown brands from a diverse number of sectors including but not limited to: automotive, aviation, FMCG, fitness, fashion, retail, alcohol, entertainment, consumer tech, government, broadcast, education and professional services. Innovation and strategic creativity are core to the agency’s success. In addition to providing strategic direction, brand and corporate communications counsel (including internal comms) and exceptional execution support, over the past five years, AKA has successfully established a full service, design and production department in-house, producing content from from social to cinema spots. Our retainer clients include the likes of Nike, Facebook, Jetstar SEA, Heineken, GIC, Deliveroo, William Grant & Sons, Nike, Manulife, Electrolux and Tourism New Zealand to name a few. In addition to having a reputation for delivering award-winning work, AKA has a phenomenally strong culture and a great track record when it comes to people retention. Work Life Balance, flexi-time, generous annual leave, team celebrations, and many other perks ensure a positive agency working environment, that is open, forward-thinking and engaging. Most importantly - we enjoy what we do, which is why we do it. Since 2012, we’ve been privileged to bring home a total of 100 awards and counting. In 2020, the agency was recognised for the third year running as one of the Best Places to Work in Asia Pacific and as one of 7 Agencies of the Decade by PRovoke Media. In addition, the agency secured PRCA’s Large Agency of the Year accolade for the second year running and Overall Agency Champion by Marketing PR Awards for the first time. 2020 also saw recognition of its client work scale new heights, with 40 awards across 4 industry award shows.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We're on the hunt for a junior-level communications consultant with creative flair, ideally with some agency experience delivering PR-led integrated campaigns, a good eye for detail and a strong sense of contribution. This new hire will join our AKA team, supporting across a range of accounts.

AKA is an integrated communications agency based in Singapore, supporting our clients locally, regionally and globally by conceptualising and bringing to life compelling campaigns. Everyone at AKA is forward-thinking, collaborative, and passionate about delivering great work for our clients (plus we're a friendly crew). We enjoy a flat hierarchy and expect everyone - no matter what level - to bring ideas to work every day, speak their mind, and positively contribute to our culture.

Our client portfolio includes the likes of Tourism New Zealand, GIC, McKinsey & Company, Meta, Vui, EDB, Manulife, Durex, Marriott International, LEGO, Foodpanda, Jetstar and Singapore Science Centre, to name a few.

What are we looking for?
· A wordsmith - you enjoy writing everything from social media captions to press releases
· You have some experience working closely with media, bloggers, and influencers
· You have an understanding of the PR landscape, including running events and social media channels
· You can provide reliable support to teams on accounts and new business
· You are good at planning your day and deliver tasks accurately and on time
· You are skilled at playing the role of co-ordinator and providing support to your teammates
· Importantly, you are a trend hunter, inspired by great work, you are a self-starter, and are always looking for ways to upskill yourself.

If you'd like to find out more, take a look at our website www.aka-asia.com or get in touch at iwantin@aka-asia.com. Please share your CV / LinkedIn profile to be considered for the role.

Only applicants based in Singapore, with a minimum of 6 months to 4 years of relevant communications experience will be considered.

Positive work life balance, 18 days AL, birthday leave, flexi-time and each year we work towards a bonus - oh, and you'll likely make friends for life (we aren't kidding).

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
My client, a a leading independent commodities trading house is looking for an Accountant to be part of the team.

Ensure accurate monthly close and meet reporting deadlines
Prepare and analyze P&L for desks/product lines

Partner with risk, operations, and other teams to ensure smooth daily business operations

CA (Singapore), degree in accounting, or equivalent
8-10 years of working experience, with 3-5 years of experience in a commodity trading company preferred
Sound knowledge of commodities trading and technical accounting
Familiar with derivatives accounting and IFRS accounting standards

Ability to plan and organize a large volume of activity, committed and capable of working under pressure to meet tight deadlines
Hands-on, independent, self-motivated, and committed, with a sense of urgency

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities

· Timely and accurate processing of invoices
· Reconciliation against vendor’s statement of accounts (SOA)
· Verify the accuracy of data input by buyer/requestor and ensure that the attached supporting documents are fill in correctly with no missing data or attachment
· Timely validation of Vendor workflow request tickets
· Validate Concur expense claim to ensure compliance with the T&E policy, business justification/reasonableness
· Ensure expenses are correctly authorised, documented, reported, and reimbursed
· Prepare open PO without IR report monthly and follow up with buyers on the outstanding invoices
· Accrual for all the VIM transactions pending for approval and approved after end of the month
· Act as a point of contact for Maison in resolving or trouble shooting issues regarding PO/VIM/Vendor workflow/CONCUR
· Conduct regular trainings on PO/Vendor workflow/ CONCUR to staffs and new joiners

Requirements

· Possess a recognized Degree in Accounting or Finance or an equivalent professional accounting qualification
· Open to fresh graduates or at least 4 years of relevant work experience preferably from MNC or large accounting firm
· Strong accounting knowledge and problem-solving skills; able to think “out of the box”
· Well versed in Microsoft Excel skill and able to automate templates to improve efficiency
· Good presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written
· Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines in a high volume and fast-paced environment
· Knowledge of accounting software/EPR systems eg. SAP is a plus
· We’re looking for a dynamic, innovative, and meticulous talent with positive attitude and strong sense of responsibility



Interested candidates please forward resume in MS Word to royhuang@recruitexpress.com.sg

title: Account Manager (Oncology)
company_info: MSD PHARMA (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. Today’s MSD is a global healthcare leader working to help the world be well. MSD is a tradename of Merck & Co., Inc., with headquarters in Whitehouse Station, N.J., U.S.A. Through our prescription medicines, vaccines, biologic therapies, and consumer care and animal health products, we work with customers and operate in more than 140 countries to deliver innovative health solutions. We also demonstrate our commitment to increasing access to healthcare through far-reaching policies, programs and partnerships. Whatever your career path – whether it’s pursuing original science in the laboratory, working directly with our customers, manufacturing quality products or supporting our business in another way – MSD offers opportunities to develop and expand your career while making a true difference in people’s lives. Learn more about who we are as a company and to discover the many reasons to join MSD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and top-ranked biopharmaceutical company on the Straits Times and Statista’s list of Best Employers in Singapore for two consecutive years (2020, 2021).
Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years.
Our Oncology team is dedicated to delivering breakthrough innovations that extend and improve the lives of cancer patients worldwide. Our team of forward-thinking individuals achieve this through an unwavering commitment to support accessibility to medicine, providing new therapeutic solutions, and collaborating with governments and payers to ensure that people who need medicines have access to them. Our focus is on innovation and launch execution excellence; we translate breakthrough science into innovative medicines that help people with cancer across the globe.
An Account Manager role will be a liaison between oncology customers and internal company teams, acting as a valuable partner for oncology customers and other stakeholders in key accounts to address their needs and pain points, delivering values to customers and the patients under their care.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Customer Engagement
Build and maintain long-term relationships with all key customers, leveraging in-house resources whenever is required to add value to customers
Identify and understand each customer’s motivation, unique business needs and objectives
Share products merits with HCPs tailoring their identified needs and provide basic product education to customers who are not familiar with company products
Understand the market dynamics and industry trends to provide advice to favorably position company’s products
Ensure great experiences and add values to customers and their patients whenever customers engage with the company
Stakeholder Management
Identify shared purpose among different stakeholders and leverage this to co-create solutions with stakeholders in the healthcare ecosystem
Create stakeholder mapping and identify key decision makers and their network of influence
Facilitate platform for different healthcare stakeholders to discuss optimum patient care & management
Communicate market and customer insights to cross-functional team to develop value-adding solutions for customers and patients
Plan, implement and coordinate internal efforts with cross-function teams (e.g. Marketing, Market Access) to deliver value for customer and other stakeholders
Account and Territory Management
Identify stakeholders and opportunities for the key accounts in territory and develop customer engagement plan for the account accordingly
Develop account plans with defining short and long-term strategy to support the growth of prioritized accounts
Identify prioritized key accounts, provide customized services to different customers in line with company service standard
Monitor performance metrics and is responsible for account performance and commercial proposals; ensures sales targets and goals are met or exceeded
Strategy Development Support
Contribute inputs and co-develops the therapy area strategies
Contribute to sales strategies and tactics development and deploy marketing activities, which are fully compliant with internal policy & compliance processes
WHAT YOU MUST HAVE
To be successful in this role, you will have:
University degree in Pharmacy or Science-related domain (biomedical, biology, life science, medical related etc)
4 year of working experience in a MNC environment with minimum 2 years of experience in healthcare, preferably in account management.
Experience in Oncology
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills including partnering with key HCPs and organizations. Experience in project management is an added advantage
Broad understanding of patient journey(s) in defined disease area(s), enabling engagement at the specialist level
Strong business acumen with expertise in commercialization and customer experience. Good track record in sales, with a history of achieving results
Ability to work in a cross-functional environment and able to influence other team members to provide best support to customers
Excellent communication skill and able to understand and leverage digital means and tools
Strong learning agility and resourceful
Our Human Health Division maintains a “patient first, profits later” ideology. The organization is comprised of sales, marketing, market access, digital analytics and commercial professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing our medicines to our customers worldwide
We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Do you have 4-8 years of relevant experience in the comms industry?
Are you looking to join an amazing team of inspirational, creative and diverse talent who will foster your growth and development?
Do you want to play a part in growing and shaping the next generation of comms professionals that you work with?
Do you want to be part of a team delivering award-winning creative campaigns?

We're looking for an account manager to join our integrated comms team made up of 55 people, to play a key role looking after earned-first remits for clients the likes of Tourism New Zealand, Meta (facebook, whatsapp), Spotify, and Heineken amongst many others. Our corporate, consumer and tech remits are hugely varied - spanning social, digital, PR, and internal comms both locally and regionally.

Culture is key at AKA, so beyond 'doing the do', we also go out of our way to hire people who are top-notch human beings - with a team-player, considerate and enthusiastic mindset.

Ideal experience:
Worked in a client-servicing, comms agency role (corporate / consumer / tech / hybrid)
Solid, adaptable writing skills
Articulate in presenting ideas and plans
Participated in successful new business pitches
Managed the team (up and down) to deliver outstanding work
Shown clear ability to manage timelines and executions
Experience working with media, influencers & bloggers
Capability across multiple platforms including social media, events & media relations

Purpose of Role:
Master at taking projects from plan to execution
Gatekeeper for quality, timelines and budgets
Build rapport and relationship with key client contacts
Manager of efficiency and effectiveness within team

title: Senior Group Accountant
company_info: Wego.com is the Asia Pacific and Middle East's leading travel metasearch engine, operating in over 50 markets worldwide and used by millions of travellers to save time, pay less and travel more. The company provides powerful yet simple to use tools that help travellers research trips, compare prices and book travel online, either direct with a hotel or airline or via an online travel agent or aggregator site. Wego was founded in 2005 and shareholders include Tiger Global Management and the Crescent Point Group.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company Overview:
Wego is a profitable, high-growth, Technology Company operating in the online travel industry with a global footprint and operations across Asia and the Middle East. As we continue to grow and expand our business, we are seeking an experienced and exceptional Group Finance Manager to lead our Finance team.
Job Overview:
The Group Finance Manager will play a key role in overseeing Accounts Receivable (AR), Accounts Payable (AP), and General Ledger (GL) functions of Wego Group. You will be also responsible for preparing monthly consolidated financial reports, analysing variances, and managing local audits of subsidiaries. If you have a proven track record of managing group audits and expertise in M&A consolidations, along with a strong understanding of financial standards, we invite you to join our team.
Responsibilities:
Lead and manage the Global Finance Operations team, including AR, AP, and GL functions, ensuring timely and accurate financial transaction processing.
Prepare and present monthly consolidated financial reports, providing insightful analysis on key variances and performance metrics to senior management.
Oversee the coordination and execution of local audits for subsidiaries, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and accurate financial reporting.
Independently manage group audits, liaising with auditors, preparing necessary documentation, and ensuring a smooth and successful audit process.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives in finance processes, ensuring efficiency, accuracy, and compliance in financial operations.
Play a key role in M&A consolidations, including financial due diligence, integration planning, and post-acquisition financial reporting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize working capital management, cash flow forecasting, and financial risk assessment.
Provide guidance on financial policies, procedures, and internal controls, ensuring adherence to financial standards and best practices.
Stay updated on emerging accounting and financial reporting standards, ensuring timely implementation and compliance.
Mentor and develop finance team members, fostering a culture of growth, collaboration, and high performance.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. Advanced degree (MBA, MSc) or professional certification (CPA, ACCA, CMA) is preferred.
Minimum 6-8 years of experience in finance and accounting roles, with demonstrated leadership and team management responsibilities.
Strong knowledge of global finance operations, including AR, AP, and GL functions.
Proven experience in preparing consolidated financial reports and conducting variance analysis.
Expertise in managing local audits and group audits independently, including experience in M&A consolidations.
Strong understanding of financial standards, regulations, and compliance requirements.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex financial data and provide actionable insights.
Proficiency in financial software and ERP systems.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in financial reporting and analysis.
Ability to manage multiple priorities, work independently, and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment.
Experience in the Middle East, India, and Asia markets is advantageous.

title: Accounts Assistant (Finance)
company_info: Confirm Good is a Singapore-based media publishing platform that brings the latest deals, news and happenings to locals in our little red dot. We offer first-hand information on deals and promotions on a daily basis and we curate and pick out the best deals for our subscribers. We are the first Telegram channel in Singapore to have exclusive partnerships with well-loved brands such as Krispy Kreme, Llao Llao, LiHO, and Tiger Sugar to offer our subscribers giveaways, one-for-one deals, and many other promotions and discounts! We are expanding to bring our tight-knit community even closer by adding a more personal touch to our offerings through Confirm Good with not only a wider variety of partnerships, but also with articles covering various topics to appeal to a wider demographic. With well-researched insights and advice spanning a wide range of topics, we seek to deliver simple to understand and beneficial contents for our readers. We are always on a lookout for talents and we can offer you a broad range of exciting careers of your choice. To qualify for a full-time position with us, we would prefer it if you have at least 2 years of working experience in a relevant field or if you can impress us with your work. If you are really keen to try your hand at something new and don’t have the experience, you can apply for our 6-month Internship Program. We look forward to hearing from you :) Don’t worry, Confirm Good Lah!
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About The Company

Confirm Good Pte Ltd is one of the fastest-growing online media publishing companies and has amassed a huge number of subscribers on our Telegram pages.

We have forged strong relationships with beloved and well-known brands locally and internationally by offering a personal touch in content creation and delivering well-researched insights. Some of the brands we have had the opportunity to work with are the likes of Singapore Airlines, Grab, Sony and Cedele, amongst others.
We are always on a lookout for talents and we can offer you a broad range of exciting careers of your choice.

Job Responsibilities:

• Handle full set of accounts
• Generate management reports and bank reconciliations
• Handle all bookkeeping for the Company and entities relating to the Company
• Responsible for all transactional accounting activities: AP, AR, GL, Inventory, etc.
• Handle GST, Payroll, tax matters, Govt grants etc
• Monitoring, analyzing monthly operating results against budget and working with management team to manage budget variance
• Ensuring on time delivery of all monthly, quarterly and annual reports according to management’s schedule
• Build good internal control system and procedures
• Other ad-hoc projects as required by CEO

Skills And Experience Required

You have a minimum of Bachelor’s Degree in accountancy or equivalent, with at least 2 years of working experience and familiar with IFRS, group consolidation and knowledgeable in ERP system.
This position is ideal to candidates with at least 2 years of full sets of experience in a start-up experience. You are able to excel in a volatility, uncertainty, complexity, and ambiguity environment, good communicator who can work independently and as a team.
(Candidates that do not have 2 years of experience but is confident they can fulfil the role are welcome to apply as well)

What is it in for you?

This is an amazing opportunity to those who want ownership of building something from scratch and potentially head the Finance Department and build up your team.

title: Account Manager (O&G)
company_info: We are a specialist search and selection company that focuses on identifying top talent, helping our global clients attract the best people in the market, adding value across all areas of their business.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a successful subsea company well stablished in Singapore and looking to increase their team hiring a new Account Manager.

The primary functions of the Account Manager are to drive sales and business development activities by adopting a pro-active approach to sales and Client support to maximise revenue opportunities with existing Clients and develop and win opportunities with new Clients.

Responsabilities will include:

Increase revenue through deep Client relationships
Proactively manage and strengthen Client relationships by being their problem solving “go to” person
Identify and build rapport with key decision makers within allocated clients’ accounts
Identify and convert revenue generation opportunities that are commercially viable with existing and new Clients by consistently promoting all of the group’s products and service lines
Sales cycle and Client service
Drive sales revenue by ensuring repeat business through superior Client service
Develop cross selling strategies and opportunities that broaden the use of the Group’s products and services within allocated Client accounts
Action all Client leads and enquires issuing and following through on all quotes and proposals in a timely manner to win such opportunities
Manage all contract administration including quotes, contract delivery schedules, utilization reports, concessions, contract extensions and terminations all in AX ensuring no overdue actions at any time
Ensure accurate and timely invoicing and resolve any sales invoicing issues in an expeditious manner
Cash collection responsibility for all allocated accounts including sole responsibility for following through on all unpaid sales invoices > 30 days old
Client account management
Manage and further develop allocated Client accounts through key account planning including developing, agreeing with line management and delivering against targets and objectives
Manage and review all allocated Client accounts performance against plans, forecasts, budgets and objectives adopting a proactive approach to identify opportunities, resolve issues and maximise revenue performance
Teamwork
Play a key role in cross-group collaboration by influencing other departments, regions and all members of staff to consistently extend goodwill and efficiency in dealing with Client requests, enquiries, support and assistance
Work closely with colleagues to identify and deliver solutions to strategic, technical, service delivery, contractual and/or commercial challenges impacting Client account performance
Market intelligence
Gather and communicate business intelligence gained relating to Client accounts, the market and the competitor landscape, creating the platform to displace competitors and identify new opportunities which will strengthen existing and develop new Client relationships
Reporting
Circulate a daily Client contact report by end of day email categorised between inbound and outbound calls and visits
Assist in the weekly revenue flash compilation as required
Prepare and contribute to periodic budget and forecasting exercises
Prepare and deliver Client account strategies and update “Map the Market” for all allocated Client accounts as required
Other
Assist with the preparation of bids in support of Group proposals
Proactive approach to identifying emerging market trends and new market opportunities for the Group’s products and services
Identify and communicate marketing & PR opportunities
Other duties as assigned
The candidate must fulfil the following criteria:
Must have thorough technical and commercial knowledge of the subsea industry and the group’s product and service lines
Ability to proactively manage Client relationships from initial approach to order closing and ongoing Client relationship management
Display strong interpersonal, relationship development and negotiating skills, outstanding commercial awareness and good all-round business practice
Well organised and decisive with excellent communication skills, capable of successfully operating in a technically challenging, Client focused, service orientated environment
Manage own workload while working towards the accomplishment of common goals/business objectives in a highly collaborative, yet demanding environment
Understand the principals of key account management and the importance of maintaining robust sales / marketing data and market intelligence
Be able to demonstrate excellent computer skills including excel spreadsheets and Power Point presentations
Conduct one’s self to ensure that the reputation of the company is maintained to the highest level possible

title: GC12794288 - Accounting Manager (Shipping)
company_info: ROBERT HALF INTERNATIONAL PTE. LTD. Founded in 1948, Robert Half (NYSE symbol: RHI) pioneered specialised recruitment services and today - with more than 325 staffing locations worldwide - Robert Half is the world's leader in placing accounting, finance, banking and technology professionals on a temporary and permanent basis. In Singapore, Robert Half operates four divisions: Robert Half Finance and Accounting: Recruitment services for temporary and permanent finance and accounting personnel Robert Half Financial Services: Recruitment services for high-calibre financial services, insurance and banking professionals Robert Half Management Resources: Recruitment services for senior-level finance, accounting and business systems professionals on a project and interim basis Robert Half Technology: Recruitment services for temporary and permanent IT professionals Robert Half also is the parent company of Protiviti®, a global consulting and internal audit firm composed of experts in risk, advisory and transaction services.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Company
Join a Global Leader in the marine industry, headquartered in Singapore with global presence.
Due to evolving business needs, we are actively recruiting for an Accounting Manager to be based in the Singapore office.

The Role
Reporting to the Financial Controller and leading a small team, you will be responsible for financial accounting and reporting, preparation of weekly flash report and monthly P&L statements for the assigned region. Ensure accurate and timely preparation and distribution of monthly reports to the management, including regional P&L, commentaries, actual vs. flash variance analysis, actual vs. budget and gap analysis. Prepare schedules for balance sheet accounts related to cost provisions, unbilled revenue, cost recoveries, stock and prepayments. Ensure appropriate actions are taken, and in a timely manner. Liaise with external auditors on audit matters and manage the audit process. Drive preparation of regional forecasts (quarterly) and budget (annually). This includes ensuring reasonable assumptions are used and the forecast/ budget is reflective of current conditions and business plan. Revenue and cost drivers are to be properly analyzed and presented to management. Being an effective business partner and engage the management team in understanding the performance drivers in greater depth, going beyond a pure reporting function. Drive value added analysis to provide useful business insights to support/ improve decision making.
Ensure efficient and effective operation of disbursements process. Identify areas of improvements to existing processes/ systems. Last but not least, provide guidance to the Finance team and support any other ad hoc projects relating to finance.

Your Profile
To qualify for this role, you must have a Bachelor Degree in Accountancy with minimum 5 years of relevant experience in a shipping MNC and/or prior Big 4 experience. This role requires hands-on experience in Excel. We are looking for a meticulous, analytical, technically competent Accounting Manager with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Apply Today
Please send your resume, in WORD format only and quote reference number GC12794288, by clicking the apply button. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Account Management team is a sales team that is part of Meta’s Global Business Group. This team is focused on connecting every business in the world with their customers on Meta platforms and then helping them grow through solutions like Facebook Pages and Advertising.
Account Managers are directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients grow their own business results on Meta through consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will have the ability to drive marketing strategy coupled with a willingness to roll up their sleeves and execute their sales tactics. Success in this position requires exceptional consultative sales, coaching, and client service skills; a willingness to experiment; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others to achieve results.
This position is full-time and located in our Singapore Office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Become an expert in Meta's digital marketing solutions for small and medium clients and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs
Grow revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with small and medium clients, and manage complex relationships
Demonstrate vertical expertise in all matters relevant to your book of business, including escalation and troubleshooting to resolve client issues
Work with small and medium clients to improve the performance of their overall campaigns on Meta platforms
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
BA/BS degree
3+ years of experience in account management, brand management, performance marketing, digital marketing, sales or consulting
Strong communication skills
Fluency in Vietnamese language & knowledge of Vietnam market are essential as the role requires to manage local accounts & communicate business strategy in local language
Ability to effectively prioritise and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail
Structured problem solving and quantitative analytical skills
Sales discipline and feel aspired to go after sales goals
Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.
