title: Account Manager, Japan (Singapore)
company_info: Facebook Our mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together.
address: MARINA ONE WEST TOWER, 9 STRAITS VIEW 018937
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Account Management team is a sales team and part of Meta’s Global Business Group.
The team is focused on enabling businesses to grow by connecting them to customers across Meta platforms using Meta advertising solutions.


Account Managers are directly responsible for driving revenue, building relationships and helping clients grow their own business results on Meta through client-centric consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will have experience in pipeline management, ability to drive marketing strategy coupled with a willingness to roll up their sleeves and execute their sales tactics. Success in this position requires exceptional consultative sales, coaching, and client service skills; a willingness to experiment; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others to achieve results.


This position is full-time and located in our Singapore Office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Drive revenue growth for our organization and the businesses we support through: (1) Being an expert in Meta's solutions for businesses of all sizes and tailor recommendations strategically to suit varying client needs
(2) Improving performance of our clients marketing spend in a client-centric manner
and, (3) Aligning clients KPIs with Meta solutions to drive incremental value
Grow revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with business of all size and complexity
Ability to effectively prioritize and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail
Become an expert in Meta's solutions for businesses of all sizes and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs
Demonstrate expertise in all matters relevant to your book of business, including escalation and troubleshooting to resolve client issues
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
2-5 years of working experience
Ability to influence C level and build effective relationships
Strong problem solving and quantitative analytical skills
Ruthlessly prioritizes and manages multiple projects
Fluency in Japanese is essential as the role requires managing local accounts & communicating business strategy in the local language
Fluency in English is essential as the role requires managing internal and external communication in English
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Worked in brand marketing, digital marketing, consulting, advertising agency or sales
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experiences
Familiarity with Meta's products and business model
Experience in an international and culturally diversified environment
Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

title: Key Account Manager - Changi Airport
company_info: VANDERLANDE INDUSTRIES SINGAPORE PTE. LTD. Vanderlande is the global market leader in baggage handling systems for airports. Vanderlande’s baggage handling systems move 3.7 billion pieces of luggage around the world per year. Established in 1949, Vanderlande has more than 5,000 employees, and a consistently increasing turnover of more than 1.1 billion euros. Changi Airport Group (CAG) has selected Vanderlande as the baggage handling supplier for the Terminal 1 Redevelopment project at Singapore Changi Airport, and we are, therefore, looking for new team members! Multiple vacancies are available. https://careers.vanderlande.com/careers https://www.vanderlande.com/news/vanderlande-secures-baggage-handling-contract-with-changi-airport-group
address: PAYA LEBAR SQUARE, 60 PAYA LEBAR ROAD 409051
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Key Account Manager
Responsibilities
Key Account Management (KAM) is an important pillar in the How to Win strategy of Vanderlande to achieve our future growth ambitions. We focus on a limited amount of Key Accounts and support them to become more successful, to benefit from their growth. The Key Accounts drive our innovation and jointly we create new market leading solutions to be seen as Industry Leader. With KAM we build long term strategic partnerships, ensuring repeating business and sustainable profitable growth.
The Key Account Manager is orchestrating a Key Account team that consists of business development, project execution, service and supporting functions. The team’s main goals are to secure future business, optimising daily operations and servicing of our solutions, as well as develop strategic, long-term relationships at multiple levels with our customer.
You are responsible for the following main tasks and activities:
Executive/owner of the Key Account across all Vanderlande functions and departments, responsible for ensuring the provision of all agreed projects, services and support:
Collaboration: between the customers and our colleagues across multi-functional departments and multi-geographical offices
Relationship: from transactional supplier towards strategic supplier, forming a strong long-term partnership
Financials: order intake and revenue, contribution margin (CM) and the return of the KA investment (ROI)
Customer satisfaction: daily performance of our solutions at the customer and an excellent execution of our projects and services
Represents the Key Account needs in the Vanderlande organisation and provides mature and realistic advice to the Vanderlande organisation how to deal with various business opportunities which may arise
Develop long term strategy and early engagement model for specific opportunities
Aligns resources (sometimes within different customer centres) and sets internal and external governance structures
Actively collaborates and aligns with Management Team of Customer Centre
Develops a clear understanding of the Key Account needs, wishes and dreams and translates this into a sound value proposition
Business partner, at executive level, of the Key Account by providing (amongst others) consult, benchmark analysis, new business models and innovative solutions.
Sets the appropriate targets for order intake, revenue, CM, innovation etc. and monitors the progress and execution
Maximises the lifetime profitability of the customer to Vanderlande
Shares learnings on KAM processes and practices across the business in pursuit of improvement across all accounts
Your Profile
Bachelor or Master’s degree;
Strong leadership, strong influencing skills and strong communication capability
10 years successful experience in similar role for a similar size company
Able to successfully build and drive high performing teams
Strong in communication and motivational skills
Excellent customer relations experience and experience in negotiating with customers
Based in Singapore

Our company
Vanderlande is the global market leader for future-proof logistic process automation at airports – from London Heathrow to Singapore Changi – and in the parcel market, for main players such as UPS, DHL and FedEx. Furthermore, we are also a leading supplier of solutions for warehousing giants, which seamlessly integrate innovative systems, intelligent software and life-cycle services.

If you aspire to a position of responsibility – and want to make a difference by facilitating the delivery of what matters most to consumers, passengers and businesses – then the next step on your path to global opportunities is to join Vanderlande. As part of our network and unique culture of freedom and flexibility, you will be connected to our dedicated people, build strong relationships and rise to the challenge of industry-leading projects.

You will grow, take ownership and make every day better as you continue on the road to success with your spirit of adventure – and fulfil your ambitions for personal development through our Academy. Vanderlande will give you the necessary knowledge, tools and support, so that together we have the confidence and ability to exceed our customers’ expectations in over 100 countries.

To achieve our collective goals, you will have a hands-on role working in a positive environment to deliver tangible, state-of-the-art products and improve the competitiveness of our highly visible customers. As an integral part of our team, you will have the enthusiasm and be driven to reach our destination before your next journey with Vanderlande begins…

Our Offer
This challenging position offers the chance to contribute to the growth and profitability of Vanderlande Industries, a company which is already years in a row chosen as “Top employer” in the Netherlands.

We offer a fulltime position in an informal, professional work and technical innovative environment with a lot of possibilities to develop yourself.

Besides your salary, we offer you the following:
Flexible working hours
Training possibilities
Travel compensation
Collective Pension and insurance
Your application
If the role of Key Account Manager appeals to you, then please apply now by completing the application form, and uploading your CV and covering letter.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Account Director – Spurwing Communications

Spurwing is an independent communications agency, specialising in two of society’s most important commodities – health and food. We are driven by our united passion for producing remarkable work that motivates and moves people.
We are a young, growing, vibrant agency and have created a unique environment that helps our people be better every day.
We are proud of what we have achieved and are excited about the impact we will make in the future.

The role you'll play:

We are looking for an Account Director to help shape and deliver excellent communications strategies to our healthcare, food and nutrition clients. In this role, you should excel in client handling, working as their trusted advisor to deliver results-driven strategies that are in-line with business objectives. You will be expected to inspire and lead a junior team and actively support the Leadership Team to grow the business and ensure it continues to thrive.

Who you are:
A valued team member that is committed to delivering excellence
Extensive knowledge of integrated Communications principles and strategies
A deep and broad understanding of the sectors in which we operate
Excellent at forging strong and effective relationships with clients, partners, and colleagues, bringing energy and professionalism into everything you do
A proactive approach to understanding your clients and their businesses
Strong written, verbal and presentation skills
Enjoy demonstrating your value through supporting others
Excellence in service and thinking, encouraging a growth mindset amongst colleagues and nurturing a passion to constantly find ways to improve
Entrepreneurial, with a strong business acumen
Minimum 7 years relevant communications experience (agency or in-house)
Additional information
Spurwing is committed to building an inclusive culture. A culture that allows us to play to our strengths, enable career growth, and support each other to be better every day.
We believe it is important to reward and recognise our team and offer an array of extra benefits including mobile phone allowance, private health and dental insurance, one week a year remote working from anywhere, birthday leave, and lots of work-versary and team socials and celebrations.
And finally, we follow a hybrid work pattern, working 3 days in the office and 2 days from home with staggered work time.

Are you ready?
Send us your resume and tell us why you are right for this role.

description:

Roles & Responsibilities

The team is focused on enabling businesses to grow by connecting them to customers across Meta platforms using Meta advertising solutions. The Mid-Market team is dedicated to empowering young and growth businesses across Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp, helping them achieve remarkable growth through our advertising solutions. You will be at the forefront of driving sales, collaborating and consulting directly with growth accounts to provide unparalleled support and guidance. Account Managers are directly responsible for driving revenue, building relationships and helping clients grow their own business results on Meta through client-centric consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will have experience in pipeline management, ability to drive marketing strategy coupled with a willingness to roll up their sleeves and execute their sales tactics. Success in this position requires exceptional consultative sales, coaching, and client service skills; a willingness to experiment; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others to achieve results. This position will be supporting our businesses in Thailand. This position is full-time and located in our Singapore Office.

Account Manager, Mid-Market Thailand (Singapore based) Responsibilities
Drive revenue growth for our organization and the businesses we support through: 1. Being an expert in Meta's solutions for businesses of all sizes and tailor recommendations strategically to suit varying client needs 2. Improving performance of our clients marketing spend in a client-centric manner 3. Strategically align clients' key performance indicators (KPIs) with Meta solutions to unlock incremental value and achieve exceptional results.
Grow revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with clients
Demonstrate leadership and industry expertise in all matters relevant to your book of business
Collaborate seamlessly cross-functionally, adeptly handling escalations and troubleshooting to swiftly resolve any issues that may arise.
Minimum Qualifications
5 min. years of experience in B2B sales, performance marketing, digital marketing/agency, consulting or related account management roles
Ability to influence C level and build effective relationships
Ability to effectively prioritize and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail.
Strong problem solving and quantitative analytical skills
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Fluency in English and Thai are required as this role will collaborate with external clients whose usual business language is English and Thai
Bachelor’s Degree
Knowledge of the media landscape of Thailand is preferred
Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge of digital media is a bonus.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experiences

Job Description:
Reporting to the Sales Director, you play a vital and rewarding role in the dynamic & growing sales team focusing in selling IT services & solutions to large SMEs & MNC customers.
You are responsible for a full sales cycle, from hunting to developing and bringing deals to closure.
Part of your account management effort, you will be also tasked to handle existing customers with new IT projects and business opportunities.
There will be excellent career progression for you to become a team lead in the department & eventually heading a business unit of your own, prior good results after a period of time.
Carrying out direct sales activities to acquire new customers (B2B) by calling & visiting prospective customers through given company’s client base &/or own contacts.
Build good rapport and expand business opportunities with existing customers.
Attending weekly sales meeting and provide updates in sales developments.
Submitting sales funnels via cloud software timely & achieving monthly/ quarterly sales target.
Work closely with internal pre-sales team (& tech folks) and key technology partners on given leads and business opportunities.

Target on vertical sectors and familiar with their business’ ‘needs’ and ‘wants’

At least 1 year of corporate sales experience in relevant industry
Minimum diploma & above in IT/ Business/ Marketing or related field
Sales or business development background with proven track record in enterprise solutions selling.

Training will be provided.

Founded in 1948, Robert Half (NYSE symbol: RHI) pioneered specialised recruitment services and today - with more than 325 staffing locations worldwide - Robert Half is the world's leader in placing accounting, finance, banking and technology professionals on a temporary and permanent basis. In Singapore, Robert Half operates four divisions: Robert Half Finance and Accounting: Recruitment services for temporary and permanent finance and accounting personnel Robert Half Financial Services: Recruitment services for high-calibre financial services, insurance and banking professionals Robert Half Management Resources: Recruitment services for senior-level finance, accounting and business systems professionals on a project and interim basis Robert Half Technology: Recruitment services for temporary and permanent IT professionals Robert Half also is the parent company of Protiviti®, a global consulting and internal audit firm composed of experts in risk, advisory and transaction services.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Company
Our client is a US MNC and Fortune 100 company in the technology industry. They are looking to hire an Accounts Receivable Analyst (Collections) on a 12 months contract basis.
The Role
You will be responsible for ensuring that the accounts receivable portfolio turns into cash, initiating collection calls on assigned account base, facilitating customer payment, resolving customer billing disputes, escalating problem collection accounts to credit and sales management. You will also be involved in negotiating payment plans, working with credit analyst on financial distress accounts, participating in process improvement projects, providing reports on assigned portfolio etc.
Your Profile
You should have a minimum of 2-3 years’ experience in a similar capacity and have good customer relationship skills, good communication skills, able to work independently in a fast-paced environment, be well organized and possess good time management skills.
Apply Today
Please send your resume, in WORD format only and quote reference number KC12794254, by clicking the apply button. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position : Finance / Accountant Manager (CPA) – Up to $8,000 – Near Bugis MRT
Location : Beach Road - Near Bugis MRT
Working hours : 5 Days Work Week – Monday to Friday: 9.00AM to 5.45PM
Salary (commensurate with experience) : Up to $8,000 + Performance Bonus + 18 Days Annual Leave
Duration : Perm
Industry : Tyres

Responsibilities:
Prepare accurate financial statement for management reporting purpose; ensure all financial reports are complied with internal and external reporting requirements.
Prepare and ensure the accuracy of journal entries to maintain the corporation's account books if necessary.
Ensure all transaction entries are system-integrated to the proper G/L accounts; maintain all general ledger accounts on a regular basis including reconciling sub-ledgers with G/L accounts.
Maintain chart of accounts which entailed creating new accounts and remove out of date accounts.
Conduct reconciliation on company bank accounts on weekly/monthly basis; reconcile balance sheet items such as prepayment, deposit, other accruals, etc. monthly.
Perform on time year-end and month-end closing. This includes preparing all necessary closing entries such as accruals, depreciation, and any necessary adjustment entries.
Prepare balance sheets, profit and loss statements and other financial reports such as monthly cash low reports.
Monitor company assets register such as automobile, furniture and fixtures, computer hardware and software and the corporation's accounting files as needed.
Ensure company’s books of accounts and related matters are handled appropriately and the company’s accounting systems are maintained according to the company’s procedures.
Support in periodic audits, inventory physical count, prepare necessary documentation and any required information requested by auditors.
Reconcile inventory reports, identify and report any issues to management and liaise with other departments to resolve issues.
Assist in monitoring departmental budgets throughout the year and report any significant deviations to management with analysis detailing the cause for the deviation and corrective action(s) necessary.
Recommend solutions to any accounting related issues using accounting systems and procedures when necessary.
Liaison with company CPA for any tax-filing issues and provides all information requested.
Improve the efficiency in the workflow of accounting department.
Participate in weekly accounting meeting to point out problems and difficulties encountered and to provide solutions.
Prepare ad hoc reports to manager, controller, and CFO.
Any other ad-hoc duties as assigned

Requirements:
Minimum Degree in Accountancy or equivalent with CPA
Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Experienced in Oracle R12 preferred
Bilingual in English and Mandarin to liaise with Mandarin speaking associates in view of business communications
Willing to travel to USA when required

Email to: jeslyn(at)searchpersonnel.com.sg or DID: 6398 5685

Do visit www.facebook.com/search.personnel for more job listings.
